criticalFailure: Your wild attempts to escape actually work against you. Your captor, feeling you struggle, adjusts their grip to be even more secure. Your movements have given them better purchase, and now you're held even more tightly than before!

criticalSuccess: In one explosive burst of controlled violence, you shatter the restraint. Your body becomes a whirlwind of leverage and force, every muscle engaged in the singular purpose of breaking free. You feel the grip falter, find the weakness, and exploit it with ruthless efficiency. With a final powerful wrench, you tear yourself completely free. But you don't just escape - you capitalize. Your momentum carries you into a superior position, and suddenly you're the one with the advantage. The tables have turned completely. You're free, positioned perfectly, and ready to dominate!

Like a trapped predator exploding from confinement, you unleash every ounce of strength and technique in a devastating escape. You twist with perfect timing, apply force at exactly the right points, and the restraint simply cannot hold you. You break free with such explosive power that you actually maneuver yourself into an advantageous position. Your captor is left stunned, empty-handed, while you're free and dangerous!
success: You work the restraint systematically, testing for weaknesses, applying pressure where it's most effective. It's not instant or dramatic, but it works. You feel the grip start to give. With one final surge of effort, you wrench yourself free. You're breathing hard, but you're loose.
Through pure determination and solid technique, you manage to break free. It takes sustained effort and leaves you slightly worse for wear, but you've escaped the restraint. Mission accomplished.
failure: You throw everything you have into trying to escape. You twist, you pull, you strain with maximum effort. But the restraint holds. Whether it's superior strength, better positioning, or just bad luck, you cannot break free. You remain trapped despite your best efforts.

Your attempts to escape are met with unyielding resistance. You try every technique you know, every trick you've learned, but nothing works. The grip on you is simply too strong, the restraint too secure. You remain held.
criticalFailure: In your desperate bid for freedom, you make a critical error. Your thrashing and twisting, meant to help you escape, instead gives your captor information and opportunity. They feel your movements, predict your intentions, and adjust accordingly. Before you realize what's happening, their grip has shifted and improved. Where moments ago you might have had a chance to break free, now you're held even more securely. Your frantic escape attempt has actually made your situation significantly worse. The restraint is tighter, your position more compromised, your options more limited. You've played directly into their hands!

Your escape attempt goes catastrophically wrong. In your struggle to break free, you inadvertently create the perfect opening for your captor to improve their hold. They capitalize instantly, shifting their grip or adjusting the restraint. What was merely uncomfortable becomes nearly inescapable. Your wild movements have been turned against you. Not only have you failed to escape, you've actually helped trap yourself more thoroughly. It's a spectacular backfire that leaves you in a far worse position than when you started!
